Luckily the taxi arrived shortly afterwards and we just made our flight in time. All this and the Hotel wasnt particularly cheap. We loved Rome and would definitely go back but will be staying somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable Location”
Reviews.Author: SABTHO
Reviews.Content: This being our first time to Rome, we were in the dark regarding where to stay and we were extremely fortunate to have found the Hotel Navona. It is within a block of Piazza Navona - THE place to be every evening after dark for couples, families, or just alone to soak it all in. In regards to location, there is no better place - it is so close to it all but still set back enough to be extremely quiet. We walked everywhere with our 5-year old from the hotel to include the coliseum, Pantheon, multiple churches (there are many in Rome!), the Vatican - although a bit far, Spanish Steps, all from the hotel. The room was sufficient for our needs and they even placed a small bed in the room for our daughter and she appreciated the attention. If you plan to see Rome and not hang out in your hotel room then this is a perfect hotel. If you are looking for amenities and luxury and to be catered to then perhaps you should keep looking. Clean and quiet and simple. Great for sightseeing in this great city. Included breakfast is merely sustenance but coffee was good. Air conditioning worked fine. Plenty of hot water and water pressure.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Navona”
Reviews.Author: Lucita08
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the hotel Navona located just off of the Piazza Navona wich was the perfect location to walk to so many of the famous sights in Rome.The most friendly staff welcomed us and were very helpful with all of the questions we had. The room was very spacious and immaculate with windows that opened to the street below with flowerboxes framing them all. The charm and old world feeling we felt was something that truely added to to our Rome experience!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: FloridaTravelingFam
Reviews.Content: After reading some previous reviews I was expecting a bare bones room, but I was pleasantly surprised. The room was nicely decorated, we were at the end of a hall so very quiet too. Great location, we walked everywhere, one day to the Forum, another to the Vatican. You can't beat this location, and for the room rates in Rome, I thought this was a pretty good deal.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: LeslieL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spend 5 nights at Hotel Navona. What a great place! Our room was fabulous, spacious, clean, private. All the staff were very helpful and friendly. The location couldn't have been better, close to all Rome has to offer. Breakfast was ok, not exceptional, but suited us just fine. Room didn't have a phone and there was no access to the internet, but when you're on holiday...who needs it! Would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Location its best feature”
Reviews.Author: artlover56
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here at the end of September. The location is really great, walking distance to many of Rome's highlights. Its an old building and the rooms are smallish, but not bad. They are clean. The bed was really hard, like a platform almost, and the smell was not the most appealing. Breakfast leaves something to be desired: so-so coffee, half a cup of juice, one fresh brioche-like roll, and then if you're still hungry there are cellophane-wrapped pastries at each table. Plus they don't give you plates, so the last person's jam, crumbs, etc are at your place. We skipped it the next 2 days. But our main complaint was the staff. They promised a 10 euro/night discount for cash but then wanted the entire bill paid upon check-in, saying it was a discount only available the day of check-in. We refused and still did get the discount, probably due to the fact that a different person was on the desk at check-out. They ordered us a taxi for the airport and told us the price was fixed at 45 euros. Our driver charged us 55 (plus dropped us at the wrong terminal), and when I emailed them to let them know he was overcharging, they claimed it was not there responsibility. Its just crummy to tell a guest one price and then have the truth be something else. Rome is an expensive city and the price of 140/150 euros is pretty good, especially given the location, but I would definitely check out other choices in this category.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: TravelSneak
Reviews.Content: A charming little hotel in a great neighborhood. The room was nice and clean and the building itself was charming. The breakfast which was included was just ok (bread and coffee). It would have been nice if some fruit, cheese, and yogurt were offered as well. All in all a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: gwjosh
Reviews.Content: This is a great find in Rome. Perfect location, clean, quiet room, good AC. The staff is very nice. For example, they called a restaurant for us to obtain a reservation and had good recommendations. I would highly recommend this hotel for someone who wants a simple, clean place to stay while you explore Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: TeacherBrugg
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Hotel Navona since 2001, so I have stayed in every wing of the hotel at one time or another. All the rooms are comfortable, clean, and have tasteful furnishings. The bedclothes are good-quality, and the staff are willing to help with logistical questions about museums and transport. Hotel Navona provides very nice accommodation in an ideal location: around the corner from the Pantheon and the Piazza Navona, and a short walk to both the Roman Forum and the Vatican. You cannot find a more convenient location--especially if you are traveling in a group. The group suite is perfect for 10-15 people! The only drawbacks are minor: if you expect an American-sized room, some of the rooms at Navona will seem small (but that's true throughout Europe). If you expect a full breakfast, know that Italians keep it simple: a hot roll with condiments, tea or coffee, and packaged croissants. However, one does not get charged extra for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location, fantastic ambience”
Reviews.Author: figoruni
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the hotel this year for five nights and found it perfectly located for all of the places we wanted to visit. We loved the inside/outside stairway - it just added to the fun. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. We had to cancel our first planned visit due to a bereavement and the hotel immediately sent their condolences and offered to transfer our stay to a later date. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay somewhere with character and charm that'll put them on the doorstep of so many Roman wonders!

Reviews.Title: “OMG Terrible”
Reviews.Author: ritbit
Reviews.Content: Listen, it's a great location. However to get to the hotel you have to go through a grungy ground floor of an apartment building. You are then greeted by a disheveled unwelcoming gentleman at the front desk (who was no help no matter what we asked of him.) The breakfast consisted of a stale piece of bread and old orange juice in a small plastic cup. The one good thing to commend was the kind and efficient bell hop who was willing to take our bags up the steep and dirty steps to the hotel's entrance. I would say it was a complete disappointment, especially after all of the reviews on Trip Advisor. Thank goodness we only stayed there one night. The old saying,"you get what you pay for" applies here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay during our time in Rome”
Reviews.Author: myoldjeans
Reviews.Content: My family and I had an opportunity to spend two weeks in Rome and chose the Hotel Navona through the recommendation of a friend. In short, our expectations were exceeded and our trip was a resounding success due in large part to the hotel accommodations and its staff. The location is second-to-none with short walks to the Pantheon, Piazza Navona and Campo de' Fiorie. Excellent restaurants are close by and you're just a block from the best espresso in Italy at the Sant Eustachio il Caffé. We were first timers in Rome and appreciated the assistance of the multi-lingual hotel staff in getting directions and recommendations of sites to visit. Rooms were exceptionally clean and well kept. We were there in the hottest part of the year and appreciated the well running air conditioning. All around the Hotel Navona is an excellent choice for your visit to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: Wingfie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on the first floor of an old building which smelt badly. Despite having booked and paid the first night's stay many months prior, we were shown to a small drab room. For example, access to the shower required stepping over the toilet. There was one single wardrobe. No drawer space. We asked where our shirts etc could be placed and were advised to use the single shelf which also contained the little safe. No other rooms were available that night so we "walked" and obtained a hotel elsewhere. Returning the next day to get our money back involved an unpleasant exchange with either the manager or owner. A very poor introduction to Roman hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Anna801
Reviews.Content: You cannot beat the location of this hotel. You really are right in the center of the city. The hotel itself is clean and well kept. The breakfast is okay. The staff was friendly. For the price I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Bang for the Buck in ROMA”
Reviews.Author: adenglish
Reviews.Content: 5 star location for a great price. The hotel was certainly clean and safe. The staff was decent but not going to go out of their way for you, I think they are all Bengali, did not meet the Australian owners. It was a little bit of a hike up to the registartion and then to our room, but it will get you in shape for the rest of Roma.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel, Great location, Great price”
Reviews.Author: AscotTraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed at this hotel with 2 friends for several nights. It is in a great location in the center of Rome. The Pantheon and the Piazza Navona are just a few minutes walk away. You are very close to lots of food and shopping. The price was excellent for being in the center of Rome in season. The rooms were clean and roomy. The hotel staff was very good. Mike and the hotel owner were great and helped us with any reservations and ideas for outings that we needed. A simple breakfast comes with the room, bread, juice, coffee/tea, but if you are looking for something more you will need to go out. This is not a luxery hotel with alot of amenities, but if you are looking for a great location, clean quiet rooms at a good price, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “loved its sister hotel residenzia zaradarelli”
Reviews.Author: eeuni
Reviews.Content: We initially booked for Hotel Navona and when i was confirming before our trip they said they had to put us in their sister hotel Residenzia Zanardarelli. It was only a block away but it was great! Even though there was a price difference they didn't charge us. The communication pre-visit was great with directions and clear pricing. Location of the hotel is perfect. i really really recommend it as its walking distance from so many sights and a short short bus ride to the Termini to catch the train to the airport. I would def stay there again. Lots of great restaurants nearby and the close vicinity to Vatican City allows you to get a head start on the queues there! A tour bus stop is right across the street from the hotel also. Lots to do in the city so you don't want to waste time with transportation. Enjoy Roma!

Reviews.Title: “A Good Basic Hotel, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Shamus780
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed 4 days here with 17 boys and 13 parents. The hotel staff put up with a lot. They were pleasant, always there to help, and got up a 1/2 hour early every day to serve us breakfast. Our last night we left @ 3am.. Our bags were carried to the curb (all of them). Mike had a gift for everyone. While this is not a luxury hotel, it was pleasant , close to everything, clean and the showers worked fine. The Piazza Eustachio is right around the corner (best Cappuccino in Rome). All the locals go here. You are close to the Pantheon, Piazza Navona. Incidentally, The Piazza Navona is named after this hotel (or family). Mike will set you straight on this. Enjoy your stay in Rome. I did..

Reviews.Title: “Basic accommodation. Location is the best thing about this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Lival
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just off Piazza Navona. It is difficult to find in taxi so make sure you have a map. It is clean and basic accommodation. This is not luxury by any means. It is a good base for sight seeing and walking distance to all tourist attractions. Our room was cleaned daily and the room was also quiet. The breakfast is nothing to write home about! It is coffee and a packaged croissant. Better to eat out. Cheap and cheerful and a base for sightseeing - stay here. Looking for luxury - look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jahower
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed at the Hotel Navona and shared a room. It had two twins pushed together and a separate cot-like bed. We all found the room to be more than large enough and very comfortable. I slept on the cot-like bed and slept very well. Shower worked well. Our room was on a courtyard with a large, heavy oak door. You cannot beat the atmosphere and location. The staff is very helpful and friendly. Location, Location, Location!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Navona”
Reviews.Author: AZS_STL
Reviews.Content: We had a family group of 13 ranging in age between 9 and 87 and stayed six nights at the hotel. We had six rooms and we were put on the first floor down the hall from the front desk. The rooms were very clean and quite large for a European hotel. The one triple room we got was very large. The bathrooms were good size with good water pressure and good hairdryers. The rooms that fronted the hotel were quite noisy with street traffic, but we used earplugs and were fine; so you might want to ask for a back room. The staff was geat! The owner and Mike were very informative about Rome's history, restaurants and even set up transportation to and from the airport for our large group. The breakfast was coffee, teas, juice and rolls- enough to get you started. We really enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Navona!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: meb999
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Navona on the first week of our honeymoon (feb 27th to march 2nd). It was VERY clean, perfectly situated (within walking distance of most sites) AND the staff was SO FRIENDLY. We loved our stay there. I'd highly recommend it, even though the morning coffee is instant (which should be a crime in Italy!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Oxheyman
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the annexe at this hotel recently and was most impressed by the friendliness of the staff and the family who own it. The rooms were clean, well priced and in a fantastic location right by the Piazza Navona. It was an excellent base and I would not hesitate to recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Navona made up for the poor English rugby performance!”
Reviews.Author: GWBReporter
Reviews.Content: Four of us made our bi annual trip to Rome for the rugby international between Italy and England on February 10th. Italy were very unlucky not to win the encounter for the first time, so it was a real bonus to be staying in the Hotel Navona, to discuss where England nearly came undone! The staff and especially the owner Corry and his interesting family, were great. The rooms were clean and spotless, with new beds installed for our arrival, plus the hospitality in showing us around this unique hotel was second to none. In terms of value for money, can't fault the Navona and will be going back for our next trip in 2010, if not before!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly & helpful staff & manager”
Reviews.Author: Roomswithviews
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two bedroomed apartment just round the corner from the hotel and it suited us very well. The staff and manager were very helpful and friendly. We were taken for a coffee by the manager and he told us a lot about the area and the building. The hotel represents excellent value for money (we paid less than 50 euros each per night) and is perfectly located. The bedrooms in the apartment were spacious, well furnished, the beds were comfortable and the water was hot! We would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to others and am sure we will stay here next time we are in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and location!”
Reviews.Author: nicola001
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a hotel. Wonderful helpful staff - if only all managers at the reception were like Mike! - and the location is first class. Rooms are newly decorated, spotlessly clean and the shower is hot! When in Rome do as the Romans do - skip breakfast and do lunch instead. We love this hotel and will be back again same time next year. Already looking forward to it!

Reviews.Title: “Home from Home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: cmw1957
Reviews.Content: This place is a gem, fantastically situated right next to the Piazza Navona, with wonderful staff who could just not be more friendly and acccomodating. Room (number 19)was large and beautifully furnished with antique furniture belonging to the owners! Beds really comfortable and bathroom sparklingly clean, excellent shower too! There is even a fridge to chill the prosecco in! We have stayed here three times now and will definitely be coming back for more. Cannot imagine there are many places which give you this value for money.Anyone who is not satisfied is just too fussy and can always go to some impersonal 5 star hotel and be happy there.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Navova-Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: tracermann
Reviews.Content: Last fall we stumbled upon Hotel Navona by accident and decided that this would be our new hotel while in Rome. The location is excellent! The owner and staff are extremely hospitable, would do anything to accommodate their guests. The rooms are nicely decorated with newer bath features. Mostly, the morning breakfast is served in a delightful dining room, with delicious coffee and some terrific home baked bread. Overall experience, excellent!!! I have travelled extensively throughout Italy and have stayed at many hotels in Rome, including 5 star Excelsior. I find it more interesting to stay where the service is more personalized and the surroundings quaint and charming. We just made our second visit in 5 months and will continue to use Hotel Navona, again a great central location for sightseeing. Great restaurants nearby too!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: quentin_16
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel via an internet search and contacted them directly. Wasnt expecting too much as it was only 135 euros a night and was very well located (just between piazza Novona and the Doumo) Rooms were small and the first room we had was a little noisy on the evening but the Hotel automatically moved us as soon as another room came free (the 2nd night). Friendly staff and well located - not bad for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay at Hotel Navona!”
Reviews.Author: MiracleTwin
Reviews.Content: There are plenty of reviews about this hotel so it's already clear how conveniently located it is. It's a short walk from many sites and a nice, longer walk from the rest. I most enjoy walking Rome because then you get to see so much of the city that most tourists miss. Every time we walked to or from Hotel Navona, we stumbled upon some amazing stores, businesses, alleys and buildings that were so charming, picturesque and off the beaten path. This was my third trip to Rome in a year and my second stay at Hotel Navona. On my first trip I stayed at the Marriott Grand Flora on Via Veneto, which I didn't enjoy as much as Hotel Navona because of its inconvenient location and lackluster accommodations (for the price). I must say the reason I returned to Hotel Navona and will continue to do so is not only the location but its staff. The hotel owner walked us down the street and bought us coffee every morning and when I asked him about his other property (Residenza Zanardelli), he walked us over and gave us a tour himself. The front desk staff is always wonderful and helps us carry our bags, gives us great recommendations for restaurants, makes reservations and calls immediately for transportation. The rooms are very comparable to what you'll see all over Europe (except with far better and more reliable heating and air than anywhere else I've stayed!). Are the rooms up to US standards? No, but then you're not in the US! I think some of these reviews are why Americans have a reputation overseas of being "spoiled" (and we all suffer the consequences of this stereotype). Space is limited in Europe, therefore the rooms will be smaller just about everywhere you go on the continent. Beds aren't state-of-the-art sleep number beds, linens aren't 1,000 thread count and you won't find strawberries and champagne awaiting your arrival but Hotel Navona is clean, comfortable and more than adequate for a good night's sleep, a hot shower and a tasty breakfast. Hopefully in Rome that's all you'll need out of a hotel anyway. Please give Hotel Navona a try with adjusted expectations and a smile on your face. Maybe you too will get coffee every morning with the welcoming owner of this quaint hotel. At the very least, you'll leave the city knowing you coudn't have found a better location anywhere in Rome to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect family stay”
Reviews.Author: Vinnie56
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Navona back in September of 2007 for a week. All I can say is what a cute little place. We discovered that the proprietors had lived in Australia and their English was perfect even though they are Italian. They gave us some tips on where to visit in Rome. We just want to go back there. Don't know when. Can't recommend it enough. Clean, great service and so central to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Lived above this hotel for two years!”
Reviews.Author: stephanie_cate
Reviews.Content: I lived on the floor above this hotel for two years so I know it very well and have had many friends stay there. The important thing to realize is that the major plus for this hotel is location- it is literally minutes on foot from all the major historic sites in Rome, especially the Pantheon and Piazza Navona. This is crucial in Rome as taking taxis is a pain. But- don't expect too much from the rooms. They are generally small, some share bathrooms, and the breakfast is mediocre. If you choose this hotel, do it because you want a bargain price in the center of Rome. I would definitely recommend staying here as it is in the absolute best area of Rome in my opinion. However, don't expect 5 star treatment!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...So-So Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: travelgrrlnyc
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at dozens of hotels based on their Tripadvisor reviews. This is the first time I feel like I stayed at a totally different hotel from many of the other reviewers. There were not many "Candid Traveler Photos" for this hotel. To give a more realistic view of Hotel Navona...I've posted as many pictures as possible and hope this helps other travelers. If you have ever tried to find an apartment in NYC on a budget...you can relate to Hotel Navona. In NYC...sometimes you put your money into location and sometimes you put it into the actual space and look of the apartment you want to rent. In the case of Hotel Navona...all of your money is going into location. The hotel is one small block off of Piazza Navona. It is a 7-8 minute walk to the Pantheon. It is a 20 minute walk to the Forum. It is a $6.80 Euro cab ride to the Vatican Museum. It is a $8 Euro cab ride to the Colosseum. There are many restaurants on the opposite side of Piazza Navona that are very good and less touristy than eating in the Piazza itself. The location is obviously extremely central and very convenient. As others have mentioned, the hotel lobby is up two flights of stairs. If you are traveling alone...this can be a problem. I tried to call up to the front desk and no one answered. Fortunately, a gentleman staying in another part of the building came along and helped me. Wherever he is...THANK YOU! :) They originally put me in a room that was in the hallway just off the front desk. The double (two twin beds together) filled the entire room. There was less than a foot of space around the bed. I was also concerned with the noise of every hotel guest walking by my room. They moved me two more flights up to 15B. As you can see from the pictures---this room on the third floor was VERY small. The furniture was crammed in the room. The closet door couldn't open because of the bed. There was no counter space in the bathroom, etc. I recommend moving the furniture around to make it work for you. There was also some random wire hanging from the ceiling which made me a little nervous in such an old building. The bed is really a cot (see picture) and the linens are clean, but itchy and uncomfortable. The towels are clean and plentiful. The TV didn't work the first day, but they fixed it on the second day. There are three English speaking channels (MTV, CNN and another random channel that sometimes showed English speaking movies.) It is a very small TV and high up on the wall. There are no telephones in the room. At first this seems fine because everyone has a cell phone these days. You notice the missing phone when you want to call the front desk...and can't. Instead, you walk down and back up two flights of stairs. The front desk also has limited hours, but you can buzz them if you need something. The bathroom is as small as you would expect. I'm short and I found the shower troublesome. I can't imagine someone taller using it. If you have ever used a "Boat Shower"...that would be comparable. The bathroom amenities include two small bars of soap and a package of shampoo that doubles as bath gel. The best part of the room is the towel warmer and blow dryer in the bathroom. They both worked great. The water pressure was also very good. The closet had some hangers that others had left behind. To be on the safe side...bring your own. There is a small safe in the closet. It is not big enough to accommodate a laptop. The safe is free of charge. They do not have irons or ironing boards in the hotel because of fire safety. As other have mentioned and I will confirm---the walls are quite thin. There weren't many guests when I was there so I was OK...but I can imagine at the height of the season it is quite noisy. I looked in on the breakfast room and it was fine. They did have the "croissants in plastic bags" that others have mentioned. It does seem like an odd choice in an area with so many nice bakeries. Because of the location...there are plenty of places to get a quick coffee and pastry. I don't know that the free breakfast is even necessary. The staff does speak English and some are very friendly. Other staff members are simply accommodating...which is fine. The car service they recommended for transfer to the airport was fantastic! I was leaving very early in the morning and was nervous about leaving when the front desk was closed. They said I could ring the buzzer if the driver didn't show up...but all that would have made me late for my flight. However, the driver was 5 minutes early. The car was new and clean. The driver was incredibly nice. He went into the terminal building before letting me out...just to confirm he was dropping me in the correct spot. I was picked up at 5:30AM which is still considered the nigh rate and the cost was $60 Euros ($50 Euros during the day). I've thought a lot about this review and I don't know whether to say I would recommend this hotel or not. I personally would not stay there again and would not recommend it to close friends. I understand that hotels are costly in Rome, but this hotel was just not good enough to justify staying in the location. The next time I would try to find nicer hotel in an area I liked or budget to spend more on my Rome hotel. This is just a personal preference. I hope the pictures will be a better guide for you.

Reviews.Title: “Spotlessly clean”
Reviews.Author: magscork
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Rome where we stayed two nights in Hotel Navona, Via dei Sediari, a stone's throw from Piazza Navona and only a short stroll from the Pantheon and the Trevi Fountain. We stayed here on the recommendation of friends, who were very pleased with its central location. From Hotel Navona we could also walk to the Forum and Colosseum and in the opposite direction, to the Vatican (although with all there is to see at the Vatican, I'd recommend saving your feet and taking the bus!) Bus No 64 was the one we took to get to the hotel, as it connects Temini to the Vatican, with the stop at St Andrea della Valle very close to the hotel. You'll have to walk up Corso del Rinascimento about 50m and then take a right into Via dei Sediari to find it. It would be easy to miss it, since the street is very narrow, but we had been given directions in the e-mail we received from the hotel, and we found it without any bother. First impressions might be off-putting. Step off the street into the litte yard (others have called it a courtyard, but that's a bit complimentary!) Reception is up two fligts of stairs. If you are not alone, I'd advise one of you stay downstairs with the bags, as it could happen that they assign you a room across the yard, in which case you have to carry your bags back down the stairs and up another steep stairs to get to the rooms on the other side. In fairness there was a porter who would have carried the bag, but my husband was happy to do it. As others have said, the rooms are pretty basic, but I would have to add that they are spotless! I was really happy with the level of cleanliness. The shower was small but had a good flow of water and plenty hot too. There was as hair-dryer. In the wardrobe we found a safe, which was easy to operate. There was also a mini fridge which we stocked with fruit & drinks that we bought in the Spar on Via Plebiscito about 100m away. We were also glad of the heater which we could plug in or not as we wished (it rained for the two days we spent in Rome). The bed was comfortable with very clean fresh white linen. However, it is as well to point out that our "double" bed was actually two singles pushed together and covered with a wide sheet! We managed fine, but this might be a factor to be considered when booking. Our room overlooked the narrow street and we had two french windows. The windows had a nifty mechanism that worked like a blind to completely block out the light, so we could sleep on in the morning if we wanted to. We skipped breakfast the first day, as other reviewers said it wasn't up to much, but we partook on the second morning. Interesting dining room! Everybody more or less shares the tables as there is very little room between them, and they run along two walls of a very narrow dining room. A good opportunity to chat and compare stories and experiences with fellow tavellers - we are all here for the same reason, no? Breakfast consisted of pastries/croissants and a bread roll with butter & jam. The pots of coffee and tea were very generous in size. There was also a glass of orange juice (concentrate). Overall, our experience was a very satisfactory one. We wanted a central location in a clean and safe environment, and we got that. Reception was efficient although not very friendly. (I found that Romans dealing with tourists, in general, were like that. Maybe they have had enough at the end of the long season?) There are two restaurants right beside the hotel, both of which looked good, but we ate elsewhere. There's a stylish bar (CO2) just around the corner (left & left again) and also an English pub, and a coctail bar/restaurant just beyond that. And I haven't even got as far as Piazza Navona !! You really are spoilt for choice with th location of this hotel. We paid €145 for the first night which we booked with credit card, and they offer a €10 reduction on the second night if you pay by cash. There are surely cheaper rooms availablein Rome, but over all I feel that we got good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: LauraMtPleasant
Reviews.Content: In May, we emailed Hotel Navona for a room for 5 nights iearly October and got back an immediate response that the hotel was full but that they could provide a small apartment near the hotel for $175 E per night. We telephoned to make sure we understood the arrangement and booked the stay. When we arrived at the hotel, we were informed that we would be staying in "the family palace" and had no idea what we had let ourselves in for, The owner drove us to the "palace" and explained that it had been owned by the family since the 17th century and that they had only recently converted a few rooms to small apartments. We were very pleasantly surprised to find ourselves in a delightfully charming apartment on Corso Vittorio Emanuele with a large bedroom, a sitting room, a kitchen, and a small bathroom. We were on the fourth floor but had a lift and Navona staff brought our luggage in and put it in a taxi for us when we left. There were double windows that blocked out noise from the street but allowed a great view--down Corso on one side and into a central courtyard on the other. We were about 3 blocks from Piazza Navona and less than 2 from Campo di Fiori, right on major bus lines, next door to an excellent coffee/cafe shop that opened at 6:00 and had great, inexpensive coffee and breads and pastries in the morning and soups and sandwiches at lunch. The family that owns Hotel Navona could not have been more pleasant and accommodating, as was the staff. I would definitely plan to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive option in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Migizi
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a few days on a Rome trip, trying to keep costs down at the time. For that purpose, this hotel is a great choice. Details... THE GOOD --Very reasonable price - at the time in 2003 it was about $120USD per night --Fantastic location, walking distance to everything (near Piazza Navona) --Accomodations reasonable THE BAD: --Small rooms --Iffy service --Accomodations are very simple, unrefined --Bathroom was tiny If you are trying to see Rome on a budget, this is a great spot. If you are going luxury, don't bother.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: PhoebeDoodle
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at the Hotel Navona in Rome. We had visited Rome twice before and are well aware that most of the rooms and bathrooms are small by American standards. Our room was small, which was fine. The room was clean and very basic - no complaints with that. Our room was on the top floor and the man that showed us up referred to it as an apartment - don't know why. Now the bad part. The walls were paper thin and we could actually see light from the room next to us from a space where the wall did not meet the ceiling. We were able to hear the neighbor on one side of us every time she coughed and that was the side that had our bathroom separating the rooms. The room on the other side was more of a problem. Although in any other hotel it probably would not have been an issue, at the Navona the walls were so thin we were able to hear EVERY word of their conversations, EVERY time they used the bathroom as well as their nightly romantic adventures. Although their bathroom separated their room from ours, it was as though they were IN OUR room. I will say the location is great - close to many of the sites as well as great restraunts and right around the corner from a good coffee shop. The breakfast was ok - coffee, OJ, a large french roll and several types of cellophane wrapped cakey things that i would recommend avoiding. The prices in Rome are very high by US standards. we paid 145 euro per night here which was much less than most of the other places i saw online or in guidebooks that did not have as good of a location. One other thing worth mentioning for those who travel with lots of luggage - there is no lift/elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic !”
Reviews.Author: Jer2007
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Navona for a week at the begining of September. It was clean and air conditioned. My room was very comfortable and I found the staff helpful. The location of the hotel was superb. Honestly, I cannot fault the hotel. The next time I visit Rome I will definately stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Hotel Navona”
Reviews.Author: barbara89
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Navona for 3 nights in November. Loved the location and loved the price! The room was small, but certainly adequate as was the service and the breakfast. We wanted to be near the Piazza Navona and this served our purposes. The hotel is convenient to all the sites. Actually we have just made reservations to stay there again next spring. The only down side would be the flight of stairs from the street to the hotel on the 1st floor, however, I just stayed with our luggage while my husband went up and ask that someone come down for all our bags. Breakfast is very basic and served in a room with tables lined up on either side of the room. As someone mentioned in one of the other reviews, if you're use to the Hilton and don't feel you can adjust, you probably should look elsewhere. Barbara89/ addedoomph@northstate.net

Reviews.Title: “Weekend break to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Kayakmuppet
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great central location and is in easy walking distance of all the major attraction of Rome. It was generally clean and our room on the top floor was small but comfortable. The only downside was the shower curtain had seen better days. Breakfast was simple; 1 large bread roll with condements, packaged crossant and good dark coffee, but that set you up well for the morning and a easy lunch on the street. For dinner there are some very good restaurants on the other side for Piazza Navona down Via di Tor Milina.

Reviews.Title: “My Mothers Visit to Rome”
Reviews.Author: FabTripz
Reviews.Content: For my mother's 70th birthday, we booked her a short break in Rome. she had a fabulous time, and was very comforatable with the accomodation and services of the Hotel.Bearing in mind the fantastic location, the room rates are well within budget. She will certainly be booking with this Hotel the next time she visits Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: MirellaToronto
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to Hotel Navona for almost two decades. The Hotel has always given me a warm welcome and they have become like family to me. I am quite surprised by the comments that some travellers have made of this family-run establishment. Being a family run business, complaints are taken personally, not as in a large hotel chain. I mention when things need to be fixed, exchanged or improved but in a polite manner. If you have an attitude that you are unhappy and everyone on either side of the reception desk should know it (we've all met travellors like that) then a small hotel (at a reasonable rate) in Italy (or most of Europe) is not for you. A traveller coming to Rome has to appreciate the high prices that hotels now command given that the Euro has more than doubled the cost of visiting the Eternal City. This sometimes makes it difficult to find a decent, well priced and safe place to stay, especially if you are a female travelling alone. Hotel Navona has provided me with this type of safe environment and this encouraged me to stay there alone or with my family. The rooms are clean, comfortable and the many renovations over the years now guarantee me windows with double-glazing that prevents the outside noise from coming in. The (very) light breakfast in the morning is welcoming but as some guests have written, if you want more than juice and a fresh bun, there are plenty of restaurants or bars within a few minutes walk that offer a greater variety. I've found this small hotel is always improving and always accommodating. If you are used to the large North American style hotels and amenities without the old world character, than this is not the place for you but of course you are going to have to pay a substantial premium to get that kind of service. Mirella- Toronto, CANADA - March 2007

Reviews.Title: “Hated the Navona”
Reviews.Author: jazz2007
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is well positioned, the rooms are nothing like the pictures shown on the website. Our standard room did not have air conditioning as stated in the web site and the room was small to the extent of being claustophobic The attitude of the owner left much to be desired, as when challenged the rooms did not match the picture on the website, we were told " You are paying for the location not the room. The exterior of the courtyard was dilapadated and uncared for. Breakfast while included was very sparse " a roll and cup of coffe and fruit juice out of plastic cups" An experience to avoid

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: Arizona_Ron
Reviews.Content: The manager was rude. The rooms were not clean. I would not stay here again. We were booked at the Residenza Zanardelli but were bumped to the Hotel Navonna. It was a very bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us...would stay there again when visiting Rome!”
Reviews.Author: KWChicago
Reviews.Content: We went to Rome for our anniversary. We were looking for a hotel that was reasonably priced, yet quiet and clean, with historic charm and close to nearby attractions. Hotel Navona was delightful and met every expectation. We are from Chicago, and if you are used to "American" hotels, this is different. But we wanted a different experience, and we couldn't have been happier with Hotel Navona. We would stay here again without question. We took a cab from the airport...in the future we would take the train, as the cab was slow in traffic and quite expensive. The hotel manager came down to the cab to greet us and even helped me with my bag (there are many stairs and no elevators here). The room was clean and with the windows closed, extremely quiet. The room was not large, but perfect for the two of us, and we did not want to spend much time in our room anyway. We walked to the Pantheon, Colloseum, and charming Piazza Navona for a lovely dinner there. We also took the train everywhere else, which was great. The staff was quite helpful with calling cabs, providing us with hairdryer and also electric outlet converters. One surprise: it said they took travellers checks, but these must be in Euros. We had travellers checks in dollars and they would not accept this. Other than that, Hotel Navona was great, the staff was friendly, the breakfast was adequate and we would definitely stay here again. Close to all of the sights, clean, quiet, and the price is right. Keri & Frank Walters Chicago, USA

Reviews.Title: “Well located in Historical Center. Could do with a lick of paint.”
Reviews.Author: nic1047
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located in Historical Center just 2 minute walk from Piaza Navona and bus to Vatican and Termini Station. Stayed here about 4 years ago and place seems the same but a little more faded and could do with a lick of paint. Rooms are quite dingy. Breakfast is still a bland 'long life' croissant with a few other bits. Prices in Rome have gone up for everything. Small beer on Piaza Navona was 7 Euros!. 70 Euros for Taxi from airport so you are best to pre-book taxi on internet or take train Rome does not have to be expensive as we discovered when we had the most enjoyable and affordable drinks in a bar followed by a perfect meal in a restaurant in Travestere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Silvergold
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights in Navona - in a tiny single room. Its a nice, clean hotel with great staff that speak English quite well. We all stayed on the main floor which is one flight of stairs up from the street level. I don't recall if they had an elevator, but I don't think so. Very basic breakfast offered. I stayed there with friends and it was during the bus strike and a national demonstration. We ended up walking much of the two days we were there, which was fine because Navona is not too far from the Vatican (about a 15-20 minute walk). Its very close to the Pantheon and there is some good shopping and great restaurants not too far away. Our last night, we ate at a wonderful little trattoria (Tritone, on Via Tritone) about 5 minutes from the Spanish Steps as the owner (or friend of the owner) stopped us on the street and invited us to have dinner with him. It was absolutely wonderful. Our best meal throughout our time in Italy! We walked back to the hotel because we were stuffed. Everything was great in Rome, too bad we didn't have more time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Auy
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at Hotel Navona and one night at the Residenza Zanardelli and enjoyed both hotel (same owner). The Zanardelli is a bit more upmarket with more attention to the furnishing details, however the room we had at the Navona Hotel was more spacious and quiter. The Zanardelli Residence is on the first floor of this amazing XIX century building whereas the Navona Hotel is in a less sumptuos buiding, but with a lovely courtyeard in the middle. Both hotels could do more of an effort with their breakfast service. Both hotels are extermely conveniently located.

Reviews.Title: “Location was good.”
Reviews.Author: Miwa&Ninja
Reviews.Content: Basically, the only positives about this hotel is the central location around the corner from the Pantheon & the staff was friendly and helpful. The room & bathroom was dirty. Our bathroom had a long odd hallway to the toilet/shower which was very tight. the only silver-lining here is that the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Pigeon Central”
Reviews.Author: Angelinas74
Reviews.Content: It's all about location at the Hotel Navona. You are literally 2 minutes away from the nicest piazza in Rome. Other than that, the hotel itself was a let down. Yes, it's quaint, it's in an old building and the breakfast was very average, but what bugged us the most about the hotel was 1)no hot water in the teeniest shower imaginable and the AC didn't work properly, 2) the walls were so thin you could hear people sneezing and flushing the toilet, and 3) the "balcony" to our room opened up not to sunlight but to ugly green plastic awnings that were crawling with pigeons. At any given time of the day/night, we could hear piegons walking across the roof outside. The website photos are very misleading. The staff was helpful and friendly and spoke English, though, which was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stocker
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Navona back in May 2006 (from 10th - 13th). A Romantic Break. We were recommended this hotel from my boyfriends parents who stayed here at the begining of the year. We stayed in room 14 (I think) right at the top. It was a good size room. We had a nice double bed - altough is squeeked alot - which got on mine and my boyfriends nerves after a while. The bathroom was a nice size and the shower was fantastic! Clean towerls everyday and bed made everyday. Breakfast was nice, it was basic - orange juice in a plastic cup, strong coffee and some pasteries - which was nice enough. The reception was not 24hr, so you had to remember to take your key with you otherwise after 10pm you were locked out! The staff and hotel owners were very nice and gave you a free map and instructions on how to get places. Its a fantastic location for sighseeing. Piazza Navona is breathe- taking along with the Pantheon, which is 'just' around the corner, St Peter's and the Cupola is a MUST, although I would definatly recommend getting there before 9am, im glad we got up extra early otherwise the ques are massive. Castel Sant'Angelo is good fun to walk around and see. The Colosseum is a MUST too - that was amazing. The Roman Forum is wonderful, you can walk and walk and walk around this all day and see something new and amazing each time. For this I think you will need a whole day to do - I did the Colosseum & the Roman Forum in one day and I think it needs a good full day or maybe 2 days - but its a good walk from the hotel and on a hot day - it could be bit ott. The Trevi Fountain is just wonderful - but its very very busy at all times. I recommend going both day and night, first and last thing to see it in its full glory! Watch out for those people who try to sell you red roses and stuipid toys - they see you coming before you do and they WILL rip you off. Just say no, but after a while you do start to loose your temper with them, so thats why I recommed go there in the morning and late at night (but not too late!) We got ripped off - they put the roses in your hand and say "gift, I give you gift" so you think brillant and walk off with your "gift" and then they come after you with how many euro's this "gift" costs! Its easier to say no and walk on. We did find somewhere brillant to eat in Rome - its right by the Trevi Fountain. As you look at the Trevi its to the right of you, about 50 yards round the corner. I cant remember what it was called, but the menu had a chickens head as the logo - sounds odd - but the food was fantastic - we went there 2 nights in a row. We also had to go to the piazza navona for a coffee on the last day, expensive as it was it was nice to have a coffee and people watch. The buses are grate too - although very busy. Its something like 1 € for 45 mins on any bus. We brough tickets there and back from the bus station - although we never got checked, its always better to pay the 1 € than been fined or chucked off! If I was going back to Rome I would definately stay at the Hotel Navona.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience at Hotel Navona”
Reviews.Author: BostonMaureen
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hotel Navona twice, and both times I've been very pleased. The rooms are small but very comfortable and clean, and the staff was courteous and helpful. The location could not be better. I highly recommend Hotel Navona.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: romatect
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a one week stay at the Hotel Navona in Rome, where I thoroughly enjoyed what I believe was a true Roman experience. The LOCATION of this place is absolutely ideal, as it is within a few steps of Piazza San Eustaccio, where one can find the best coffee in the City; a few steps from the bus stop which delivers you from Termini Station; a few steps from the Piazza Navona, Romes greatest public space; a few steps from the Pantheon, Rome's oldest fully-intact temple to the gods. This is right where I wanted to be. As far as the negative reviews which complain about the size of the rooms being small, this is certainly true, but this is a small hotel in a very cool building several hundred years old, in an area of PRIME real estate. That character was what I was looking for. And the rooms were absolutely spotless. None of the other hotels where I would even consider staying in this excellent neighborhood (the rafael, albergo delsenato) are in this price range. And the staff were among the friendliest people I met in Rome. I will indeed be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Profoundly disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated but besides that it was expensive :Euros180 per night even though the guidebooks price it as moderate. I asked specifically for a quiet room and received precisely the opposite: traffic and pedestrian noise all night long. The bathroom stank to high heaven and the beds were not comfortable. The breakfast was worse than a McDonalds fast food experience. Cheap, packaged croissant, cheap cereals - nothing to write home about here. Overall I would say this is probably the worst hotel we have ever stayed in on holidayand I am not extremely fussy! The staff were friendly and accommodating although they did not accept a credit card and wanted cash or trveller's cheques in Euros only. A waste of money and would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “italian with attitude”
Reviews.Author: lynnderby
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at theHotel Navona...or should I say an apartment they owned on the Vittiore Emanuelle....a 10 minute walk away. The apartment was booked back in January by an Italian speaking friend, and a price was agreed .Hoever when we arrived there was some dispute over the agreed price and the elderly owner didnt care if we stayed or not. He demanded 20 euros a night more and cash up front.Unable to resolve the issues,wWe proceeded to the apartment...very spacious but very basic.The sheets were darned and had holes in them!! The kitchen had an odd array of chipped crockery and two saucepans that I refused to use as they were so disgusting.The management did agree to change the sheets but as for the kitchen we were told was to be used" only in emergencies" and we could go to the hotel for brakfast .....We went to breakfast twice and decided to buy elsewhere as it really wasnt worth the 10 minute walk each morning. At the end of our stay we paid the original agreed fee as we dealt with Cory who remembered the original conversation back in Jan and was very kind and helpful...it was such a pity that the older man and the sour faced woman werent as obliging. Dont think I would make a return to the Navona Interesting to see no one else who has left comments seems to have stayed in the apartment!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ignore all the negative reviews!”
Reviews.Author: rekrab
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Navona for 2 nights last week and after reading the comments on T A were pleasantly surprised with what we found. The bedroom was comfortable and the bathroom was cleaner than some 5 star hotels. The terrible tales of 'disgusting' breakfast shouldn't be believed - it was more than adequate - juice, rolls, croissants, jam, butter, tea or coffee. Other guests at the hotel who we spoke to all had positive reports and of course the wonderful location couldn't be bettered. We would definitely stay there again, Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Navona 10 -14 April 2006 with my wife and 11 year old son. The room, and taxi transfer, was booked in January and the hotel organised everything as requested. 2 weeks before the visit, I stumbled on the TA website and I was horrified with some of the reviews (ie the most recent ones) I expected stopping in a "hovel" owned by a mad Basil Faulty type manager!! My experience is neither of these were true. I found the hotel served the purpose for the money I paid (we were only charged for 1 night on credit card when I booked and I was not asked to pay up front) Our triple room was of an adequate size and very clean, with 3 single beds which were comfortouble. The bathroom was small but all 3 appliances were in good service. Towels were changed daily and the room was cleaned on the same basis. The room backed onto the famous courtyard complete with neighbours washing and some rubbish, not the best view in Rome but we didn't pay for the view! The free breakfast was an experience, but we had a laugh with the other guests and skipped it after the first day (Get a takeout at a local cafe 6E for 3) As reviewed before, the location cannot be beaten..All the major attractions max 25 minutes walk and Piazza Navona 200 yards. The staff were there when you needed them but apart from saying hello and goodbye, we didnt bother them and them us I think this hotel is a good base for a visit to Rome,at an affordable price in an unbeatable location. Dont expect 5 star luxury at 1 star prices. I would advise organising a taxi transfer from the airport which saves a lot of hassle and has the advantage of you being dropped off at the doorstep thus saving enough energy to walk the 30 steps to the hotel reception, again onother previously noted negative point which I didnt see as a major problem

Reviews.Title: “Arrogant and Dirty”
Reviews.Author: SuzieGalwayireland
Reviews.Content: This 'hotel'is a joke. I have travlelled extensively round the globe and have NEVER NEVER been treated so badly! On viewing the rooms we returned to reception to ask politely if they had any others as they were not acceptable. Immediately we were shouted at with the manager shouting at me "YOU ARE WRONG!!!" Then another lady took over and sneered at our opinion that the rooms were ridiculously small! She proceeded to shout at us and march us round to look at other rooms equally disgusting hovels! She was actulaly nasty! A single room that we had booked did not even have enough room for my suitcase. When using the bathroom your knees were in the shower and you scraped your side off the toilet roll holder! How in any country can this be acceptable especially for the price! They acted like the reduced rate (1200 for 4 nights)was a huge favour to us! The arrogance of these people is unbelievable and I agree with other reviewers who say that you are imposing on them. They did not speak to us for the rest of our time there just flung flithy looks! Why did we stay? First of all it was raining really heavily when we arrived. We actully had to have the door pointed out to us as there was no evidence of a hotel. You have to go up three flights of stairs with no help. We had three suitcases and not a notion of where we were. Also when we said we would stay only one night we were told to "leave now because it is not worth it for us!". You then have to pay for all nights up front obviously a policy they have developed due to many complaints! We were in shock! The breakfast is (---) and not worth getting up for. The view was of a dirty courtyard and a washing line the rooms were not newly refurbished but dirty. The wardrobe was so small that my clothes did not hang in it straight, the sink was not in the bathroom but in the room, the moulding which looks so great in the brochure was polystyrene. Oh yeah and in our three rooms there was not a curtain to be seen!!!! The noise is ridiculous from staff getting ready for work, changing their clothes outside your door, to street noise and slamming doors. And just for atomophere there was a washing machine in the "beautiful" hallway! The brochure and internet site are truly misleading do not stay in this DUMP as the location does not make up for the arrogance and dirt of the place! SPEND YOUR MONEY ELSEWHERE!!!! DO NOT GIVE THEM YOUR MONEY!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “misleading website”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Navona a few years ago, and while it was clean, I was disappointed. We stayed in a very low-ceilinged room that looked out into the always dark airshaft/courtyard with laundry, trash, and views into other people's apartments that some have mentioned. (Also as some have mentioned, the guidebook-touted courtyard and ancient fountain are not impressive or attractive.) The staff was somewhat unresponsive, but not impossible. For instance, when we went to Florence for a couple days, they kept our bulky luggage for us in the interim; they just kept us waiting a very long time while we waited to pay and check out. The absence of a television was not a problem for me, and while the breakfast was underwhelming, that wasn't a particular problem either, as there are wonderful cafes just outside, which would be preferable to even a wonderful hotel breakfast. On the plus side, the bathroom was a reasonable size, nicely decotated, with good hot water. And of course the major plus, and it is worth a great deal, is the absolute perfect, amazing location, which allows you to stumble into the Pantheon without even trying--a magical experience. Given this, and given that we stayed there in the off-season and back when the dollar was stronger, so the hotel was a good deal cheaper than it is today, I think it was worth the money. I wouldn't go back to it at current prices. I think, however, that one reason the reviews here are so negative is because there is an enormous gap between the impression given by the website photos (and by the fountain-touting guidebooks) and the reality of many or most of the rooms. My impression of the Hotel Navona would be much warmer if it had simply been upfront about the simple accommodations in its self-promotion. The website's pictures of high carved ceilings, elaborate curtains, and enormous windows, even if technically correct for the rooms pictured, are simply not representative enough to stand alone on the website, even with allowances made for the inevitable flattering shots in this context. I think people here would be less angry if they did not feel they had been lied to. It's not a matter of expecting five-star accommodations; it's a matter of expecting something comparable to what is promised. Unfortunately, Hotel Navona failed to deliver that, which obscures what it does deliver.

Reviews.Title: “Top location”
Reviews.Author: Stephi1975
Reviews.Content: For my wife's 30th birthday I arranged a trip to Rome and a stay in the Hotel Navona. As a surprise I invited another 11 couples so there were 24 of us in total. I was a little aprehensive of arranging such an event and if the hotel was not up to scratch I would never live it down. I arranged my trip with Micheal on reception who was very efficient and even booked a restaurant for us. The rooms where very adequate for the visit and everyone in our party though that the hotel offered a fantastic location and a certain rustic charm. I read some reviews from Americans mainly complaining about the room sizes etc and I have to state that you dont get 5 star service unless you pay for it. Everyone in our group agreed that they would use it again and I am looking forward to.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but TINY Rooms & Bath”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Clean but VERY small rooms and bath. No TVs and no phones in rooms. Very close to Piazza Novona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location;Not bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located within steps of all the major sights. It is literally one block from the Piazza Navona. Overall the rooms were small, some smaller(tiny) than others, we've experienced both. The beds aren't comfy, but who cares if your out all day. This is definitely a no frills hotel; its main advantage is the LOCATION. Mike, the receptionist, was very accomodating and spoke english.

Reviews.Title: “great position shame about the bed”
Reviews.Author: mememe_11
Reviews.Content: The position can't be faulted. My room was so small I couldn't swing a flea let alone a cat but the positives - it was clean and close to everything. My negative was the awful bed and pillow. After walking until I couldn't walk another step I wanted a bed in which I would be comfortable to sleep but my bed resembled a block of concrete and the pillow was no softer and so thin as to be useless. The breakfast was filling if nothing and I loved the orange juice served in a plastic cup. Would I stay there again - yes but I would ask for a different room that was a bit larger and take my own pillow.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Navona for 3 nights (in December 2003)and were very pleased with the hotel and service. It is in a charming building. Even though the hotel is off of the main streets we did use our ear plugs while sleeping, since Rome is a big city and pretty loud even at night. But we were use to doing that in large cities so we weren't upset. The breakfast was simple, but it was sufficient. The staff was friendly. I would recommend this hotel to friends!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal and location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Loved the Hotel Navona. We found the staff friendly and most helpful after my husband was robbed at Rome train station! They called the embassy, taxis, etc . for us and did what they could. Room was comfortable and clean with a/c. No TV, but that wasn't a problem for us. Breakfast was basic and Italian style...just good coffee and brioche/bread, but I was happy with this, and if you're not, there are great cafes within minutes of the hotel, which has one of the very best loctions in Rome. If you don't want to spend a fortune, want a good location, and are happy with a small, no-frills hotel, I recommend the Hotel Navona.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: WilliamD
Reviews.Content: Having booked this hotel on reccommendation from a hotel inspector (I work in the industry), I was then horrified to read the reviews on this site. Without reading the reviews I would have been disaapointed with the hotel, however I dont think the hotel is as bad as some of these reviews may hint. The biggest selling point is location - Piazza Navona is perfect with traders and many pizzerias, Vatican is 15 mins walk as are the Spanish steps. The hotel is more of a b&b. I guess your stay would depend on what room you had as all are different. Ours was small but clean, so we were happy going out all day and just crashing out overnight. Staff werent rude, no more than any other hotel we stayed in - we had hot water problems and they ensured it was fixed within minutes. On our last night we paid £50 more and stayed at the Mecenate Palace, staff were terrible but worth the £50 extra

Reviews.Title: “Great Price , Great Location”
Reviews.Author: respbill
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a great area, as we walked to Vacatican and up to Spanish Steps, Roman Ruins. All is there with many small streets with loads of places to eat and at all price ranges. The rooms were clean and bathrooms were exceptionally clean. Only negatives were the breakfast which is coffee and a roll but enough to get you going and staff can be distant. We were locked out one night as there is no central key given for the main area (hotel is located on third floor of large building) and ended up staying with our friend who lives in Rome that night, and we were not aware that we would not be able to get back into the hotel. If you want a good place to rest your head and not have to worry about taxis, buses, or underground, this is the place. We only took a taxi to and from the train station when we arrived and left. I would stay there again. Of course if you need American standards of large rooms and a full breakfast then this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price, forget friendliness with staff”
Reviews.Author: cubanica
Reviews.Content: This is a very good option for staying in Rome. Location is very good, rooms are clean and spacious, breakfast can at least get you going and the staff....well....just remember you are not there to socialize. I am sure their ratings would be way better if they were a bit friendlier. I would stay here again . An excellant value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “you get what u pay for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel twice and have found it to be clean. The staff arent going to love you to death and the owner is a little too pleased with himself - but thats ok - because I didnt come to Rome to spend the day shooting the breeze with them. The breakfast, breakfast room and staff serving it, leave much to be desired and you wont be missing out if you dont have it ,and thats what I recommend you do, as there are plenty of nice places you can go to near the hotel for fresh coffee and bread. The hotel is in a great location and for €140 a night you are not going to get much better, so would all those who are looking for 5 star quality (based on the other reviews here) do everyone else a favour, unlock their wallets and pay $500 a night for a hotel where they'll get what they want. You wont get much in New York for $140 so why expect it elsewhere. I cant believe some of the negative reviews here. One even complains about audible noise when in the room during the day. What were they doing there during the day??? Another complains about insufficient room in the bathroom for two people - please!!!!!!! This is one of the great cities of the world - the hotel is in the centre of it - quit complaining, get out and see it. If you walk the legs off yourself during the day, like you should - you'll be too tired in the evening to care about the five star niceties that are missing in Hotel Navona.

Reviews.Title: “bad attitudes, nasty rooms”
Reviews.Author: Virginia_painter
Reviews.Content: I spent a week in this hotel in the spring of 2004. I should have heeded the warnings on this site. Anytime a hotel insists on cash in advance, it is not a good sign. The room was uncomfortable:cramped, noisy and dirty. The worst part was dealing with the contemptuous and unhelpful staff and owners. You can do much better. Keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Only two positives: large shower and location. Although the shower was large, the room was definitely not. There was a lot of street noise. The staff is not accomodating. It's as if you are bothering them if you need some information. The woman who works there didn't smile once. The staff and owners seemed annoyed to have guests! Not sure what kind of coffee was served at breakfast -- not caffe latte or cappacino and not quite American. A big disappointment for the money.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Navona
HotelInfo.Address: Via dei Sediari 8, 00186 Rome, Italy
